summary: The bill, titled the Ensuring Sound Guidance Act of 2025, amends the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to prioritize pecuniary factors (financial considerations) in investment advice unless informed consent is given to consider non-pecuniary factors. It mandates the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to study climate change and other environmental disclosures in the municipal bond market and to investigate the solicitation of municipal securities business, focusing on the effectiveness of existing rules in preventing corruption and the impact on small, minority, and women-owned businesses.
